review.title: Hotel convenient for the airport with good shuttle
review.reviewText:
Main issue wss that they didn't have a record of my reservation and weren't very helpful initially telling me I would just have to call Expedia myself and sort it out. Not helpful after a 10 hour flight. 
After that ok.

review.title: CLOSE TO THE AIRPORT.
review.reviewText: I have stayed at a few Doubletree Hotels, and this one is not real pleasing. The mattress was not comfortable at all which lead not a good night sleep. The A/C  did not work properly
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff name Jennfer, very friendly and  helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: pillow top mattress ansd better shower heads.
review.locationRemarks: shopping was nearby which was great

review.title: Cozy, great staff, relaxiong
review.reviewText: Arrived really tired and was welcome with a warm cookie and live jazz, very relaxing!!

review.title: Comfortable and clean. Great staff and good food
review.reviewText: This is the second time we come back. The overall experience was great, but what makes us come back is the friendliness of the staff. Thank you Jenny, Jessica, Rusty and Jesus!!!
Couldn't get into my room. Problems with keys.  Everything was corrected and I received a free dinner for the inconvenience

For a shuttle that leaves every 15 mins. for the airport, it sure doesn't pickup every 15 minutes.  Fire alarm went off at 3:45 am (for about 30 minutes) and disrupted our sleep.  Front desk staff gave us incorrect information about getting to the Oakland Airport and we almost missed our flight and, therefore, didn't have a chance to get any breakfast before boarding a 5-hour flight to the east coast.  Otherwise, everything was good.
This is cozy Hotel and the room is big.  The bed is confortable.  We enjoy this hotel when we stayed.

review.title: convenient to the airport
review.reviewText: Getting to and from the airport was important to me as I was not going to have a car available to me for my short visit. I walked out to the hotel area at the airport and the shuttle was there. They run every 15 mins and you never have to call and make arrangements. very convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are nice and have a beautiful view of the bay.

review.reviewText: Very nice staff and the room was clean. The bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel by airport
review.reviewText: This was a very convenient place to stay to fly out of SFO in the morning.  It was of course a little noisy being right by the airport but a very nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: the drapes did not cover the whole window
review.locationRemarks: very close to airport

review.title: The shower
review.reviewText:
The 'walk in shower' is terrible.
The second morning we showered, apparently the drain was plugged!
When I pulled back the shower curtain, after my shower, water had completely filled the bathroom floor, and made its way into the front room area.
After 1/2 hour, using every towel in the room, I managed to clean most f the mess.
Our last day, we did not shower!
review.negativeRemarks: The shower area
review.locationRemarks: SF! very exciting city

review.reviewText: Close to airport, with great, timely shuttle service.

review.title: Wonderful stay!!
review.reviewText: Parking fee should be lower... At the rate of hotel there should be no parking or even a smaller amount.. Thats my only complaint

review.title: Just okay.
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, there were three clerks, two of which were waiting on guests, and one who was ignoring us.  She never asked if we needed help--we had to approach her and ask her if she was able to check us in.  The hall area to our room smelled of -- marijuana?  Weird ...  The guests next door were very loud that night.  Not our favorite place to stay.  The hotel restaurant is very over priced.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant, the noise, the smell, and the service.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing special about the location other than it is not too far from the airport.

review.reviewText: The hotel had no record of my reservation and were sold out.  They said this often happens with Expedia.  They (Hilton) were courteous to find another hotel for me.  I  will never use Expedia again.  I want my credit card refunded immediately.

review.title: Room with a view
review.reviewText: Room view not with a view only about a fourth of the bay we could see.  Told shuttle service for hotel would take use anywhere only around the area it would take us.  Very upset about this.  Thought the majority of the staff was rude.  Doorman Dennis was nice and went out of his way to help. Won't use Expedia again.  Rooms weren't worth what we paid. Need to have option for cookies some people are allergic to nuts.

review.title: Ideal after long flight
review.reviewText: Stayed for two nights. The room was well appointed and clean, but smelled of stale food. later worked out that it was three floors directly above air vents for kitchens, so that was the reason.
review.negativeRemarks: Better filters on kitchen ventelation.

review.reviewText: Nice place, decent price, easy access to transportation. Let us check in early

review.title: Nice hotel next to the airport
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel that's right next to the San Francisco airport. There is a great bar downstairs with good food. The only thing I could complain about was they charged $22 to park and the security gates did not work. Overall though it was a pleasant experience.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Chose to stay at the hotel due to its easy access to the airport as I had an early flight to catch.  The service was good and hotel staff were very helpful and polite.  Even though I had requested for an early-check in, due to flight delays i was only able to check in after the meeting and I feared that the almost 11-hr delay may have resulted in a room cancellation.  I was glad to hear the person on the other end of the phone say that I still had the room.  :)

managementResponses.response:
Dear Yvonne,

We’re very sorry we didn’t provide you with a satisfactory experience during your recent stay at our hotel. Your satisfaction is very important to us, and we appreciate your feedback about the generator/traffic. Your comments have helped us to improve our guest experience, and we’re now offering free earplugs at the front desk. We hope you’ll stay with us again.

Sincerely,
Mike McKee
General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel noisy motor
review.reviewText: Although we had a lovely room, service etc, I found it impossible to sleep as there was a fan/motor/generator running outside all night. We could also hear traffic, windows did not appear to be triple glazed for such a built up area. We were in room 532 which backs onto the internal part of the building.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, room service prompt, lovely staff
review.negativeRemarks: Triple glaze or turn off generator
review.locationRemarks: Near to airport

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: It was very nice hotel , So Close to airport . We arrived in 20 min from the hotel in down town . Staff was so friendly ! We needed minibar in the room but we it wasn ' t !

review.title: Stopover
review.reviewText: Our day and evening at the double tree were very pleasant. The location is wonderful and the hotel staff were courteous.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of the bathroom area
review.locationRemarks: Great for walking and clearing the head, refreshing when in transit.

review.title: Excellent hotel near airport
review.reviewText: Needed a room for last night in San Francisco, very clean, friendly staff easy access to airport.  Highly recommend.

review.title: Convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: Booked the Doubletree SFO for a quick 2 day trip to San Fran.  Very nice hotel.  Far enough from SFO not to be disturbed by departing flights.  Clean.  Great staff.  Overall very  good hotel even by aircrew standards.

review.title: VERY nice hotel, with ocean views!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was wonderful!  The room was fantastic, clean, updated and plush.  The restaurant was very good as was the lounge, although both were a bit expensive.  The one downfall was the lack of a pool and/or hot tub.  After speaking with the front desk, we found they had an "arrangement" with the hotel across the street to use their pool.  Not my first choice to walk 1/2 block, cold and wet, to my room.  However, the view in the morning was lovely, watching the fog burn off the bay.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very modern and new.  Location was close to downtown San Francisco, without the crowds and the prices.  Lovely views all around.
review.negativeRemarks: At least a hot tub on the hotel grounds would be nice.  We had just finished a lot of driving and were looking forward to a nice soak!
review.locationRemarks: It was only about a 30 minute drive to Fisherman's Wharf and The Embarcadero.  We could also walk to a small, rocky beach.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful staff nothing was too much. The airport shuttle was a major bonus, as this was a link to the BART at SFO airport.
review.negativeRemarks: free breakfast and parking
review.locationRemarks: Not much nearby, but the airport shuttle was very useful, especially as a link to the BART at SFO airport

review.title: OK Before Catching a Flight
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok.  There was a hole in the bathroom door with evident patch work.  No fridge in the room so I had to drink warm beer and the restaurant was mediocre at best.  Also, the shower would not maintain a consistent temp.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Quickly get to the terminal using hotel shuttle. There is a shuttle that takes you to the Burlingame mall
review.locationRemarks: 30 minutes from San Francisco and 30 minutes from San Jose

review.title: You risk being stranded at the airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine, what you would expect from the chain. The problem was that the driver of the courtesy shuttle bus completely ignored me at the hotel shuttle stop at the airport. It was totally impossible for him not to see me, as I made a clear sign while he was approaching, made a second sign to the rear view mirror when he passed me, and then even ran after him when I realized he was not stopping. He might have been in a rush for whatever reason, or might have skipped me because I did not have luggage with me (I had gone to the airport to give back the car I had rented and I was going back to the hotel to fetch my family), but that was not a good reason. I ended up being stranded at the airport for over half an hour (mind it was 9 am not the middle of the night...). Luckily, having small children I always plan to have a lot of time for everything I do. Had I been in a rush, it would have been a problem. And, above all, as it is a hotel airport, transportation to and from the airport is one of the most important elements of the service provided. Also, I have not felt that the management took seriously my complaint. I have had no feedback whatsoever and no sincere apology for the bad service. As there are many more options available at SFO, I strongly suggest considering another option.
review.negativeRemarks: Service and customer relations.

review.title: Nice stay at the Doubletree
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff.  Rooms very comfortable and clean.

review.title: Double tree review
review.reviewText: Fantastic location close  to the airport.friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs up dating.dark in bedroom.in need of lighter decor.
review.locationRemarks: Couldnt be better

review.reviewText: First of all, SF's traffic is bad. However, the hotel is good. Just the window is a little bit small. I stayed in a room with bay view. They also offer hot cookies when checking in. Really nice. The bed is very comfortable.

review.title: A great overnight stay - near San Francisco Airpor
review.reviewText: I spent one night in the Double Tree by Hilton as i had to catch a very early plane out of San Francisco.  I had a large King size room .. the rates were very reasonable.  The room was well equipped and clean.  The information did not mention how lovely the area  was.  Right on the waterside directly opposite the runway accross the Bay.  The hotel is part of a complex with expensive neighbouring hotels and there are flowers, lakes and wild life.  The courtesy bus was brilliant .. running every 15 mins it took all the stress out of an early trip to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: The courtesy buses to the airport and also to the surrounding shopping and resturant areas.  The area was suprisingly beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: There was quite a musty smell coming off the carpets both in the room and the corridors .. they could be cleaned or better still got rid of.  The menu
review.locationRemarks: Walk along the shoreline ... visit the local areas tho that needed the courtesy bus.

review.title: Would have been nice if....
review.reviewText: We booked through Expedia and were so excited to find a confirmed room for last Tuesday night.  Gave our credit card and voila, we were all set.  But wait, upon arrival at midnight they were full.  How can this be when we have a confirmed, paid reservation?  Watch out Expedia users, a confirmed, paid room is not what it appears to be.

review.title:

review.reviewText:

review.title: Extra fees
review.reviewText: By the time you add in the parking and other hotel fees, you could pay for a hotel that has larger rooms, comfortable beds and a free breakfast. The room advertised to sleep five. However, when they put the roll away for the fifth person in the room, there is no room to even move around the room without climbing over the beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds where sagging in the middle.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText:
Regular shuttle pickup. Shuttle to Burlingame gives restaurant and shopping options. 
Beds comfortable, room was quiet even tho it was by fitness centre.
Breakfast across road at Leanne was value for money. 
Mexican dinner at golf shop behind hotel was tasty and cheap.
No pool at hotel but could use pool at Red Roof across road, which kept children happy.
Happy to be staying here again on our return journey.

review.title: OK Hotel. Room was adequate nothing special. Not e
review.reviewText: As I said above room was OK. Restaurant and Bar was great. Food and service were good.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was not great or worth what the room charge was.
review.locationRemarks: No comment

review.title: Nice clean..
review.reviewText: Booked a room for 5 but son had to sleep on floor..  $22 a day for parking is ridiculous

review.title: Great airport hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had a super short stay at the DoubleTree SFO (less than 5 hours) but it was great. The room was large and clean. The staff was great. The shuttle to the airport was super convenient. It runs every 15 minutes, 24hrs/day. It made it so much easier to plan getting to/from the aiport. Of course the chocolate chip cookies are always great.
review.locationRemarks: Great airport location

review.title: Awful, 2 star at most.
review.reviewText: The place is significantly aged and not well looked after. Staff is not the most professional and internal conflicts are most visible. An overwhelming amount of untrained Mexicans are employed at this location. Severely overpriced.

review.title: Great food at their Restautant
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience. The hotel was very good but their restaurant was way better than your average hotel diner. Good selection of wine and fresh local ingredients.

review.title: Best hotel closest to SF airport
review.reviewText: Room and amenities were up to date. Pleasant room décor.  Beddings are very clean and stylish.  Bed is so comfortable, I can stay in all day.
review.locationRemarks: Several trendy shops and restaurants nearby.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The hotel in itself was nice but $22 a day for parking is way out of line. The closet didn't have the space for my dresses. I had to hang them from the mirror. There was only hanging space down low and just enough length for shirts. We stayed for 3 days and each day the door was not completely shut. We only had to touch the door and it opened....so anyone could have entered the room. Not Cool! The room was clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was a nice size. We would not stay there again. We have received much more for much less at other comparable hotels!

review.title: Conveniently located close to SFO
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for a short layover, however, price is a little bit high.

review.title: Good location for airport and SF if u have a car
review.reviewText: We had a 4 night stay to visit SF, it's a great location if u have a car and are visiting the city. Or if u need to be local to the airport. A lot of aircrew stay there overnight. Situated on the bay with a view of the airport in the distance. We really enjoyed driving into San Francisco each day and comIng back to the relative peace of the hotel. It's 20miles to the city so be aware if you do not have a car. Airport 5 miles or less. Really nice island bar with friendly staff that always remembered your drink and where you liked to sit. Bar food and light evening meals were good quality and reasonably priced. My only criticism if at all was the buffet breakfast. 6 til 10am. We arrived at 0930 and it was chaos!. The staff were all over place trying to clear things away. Reluctant to serve us, served us the wrong drinks, little or no food available( still got the bill though!!). no cutlery or crockery. It was a shambles to be honest. Maybe just that day I couldn't tell you. The last three days we got breakfast out on our way to the city. We drove from Vegas in a hire car and dropped it to San Fran airport so it was really good for the location. Staff are great, room was adequate for our needs. I'd go there again for sure. But I'd eat out at breakfast. Cheaper too..
review.positiveRemarks: Great location , friendly staff, nice room, good views, easy access by car or from airport via shuttle bus . We enjoyed our stay there
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast buffet should be to 11 and all food/drink should be available to that time. Not run down to nothing 30 minutes before close.
review.locationRemarks: International Airport 5 min drive away, and a shuttle service operates to and from. San Fran City is 18 to 20 miles away.

review.title: Good place to stay!
review.reviewText: We were happy with our stay. The staff were particularly professional during a very stressful time.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great rooms and great customer service and the beds were super comfortable and the staff was just excellent

review.title: Nice hotel, close to airport
review.reviewText:
Good experience overall.  Staff was courteous and helpful.  Bar and restaurant areas were both nice.  Room was comfortable overall. 

Fourth elevator from the lobby has a bad bearing...really loud door opening on the second floor.  Bed was surprisingly uncomfortable and seemed worn out.

review.title: Friendly staff and pleasant stay
review.reviewText: I like the front desk staff. They are so friendly and carefully explained everything for you. The room is clean and spacious. Nothing fancy, but very comfortable. The shuttle service is very convenient. There is also trolley to take you to downtown for shopping and dinning.
review.positiveRemarks: friendly staff and convenient shuttle service.
review.negativeRemarks: The design of the room, esp. the bathroom. For example, in the spacious bathroom, there is no place near the bathtub to put towel handy
review.locationRemarks: convenient to stay a day or two for flight connection or tour.

review.title: Close to the Airport and Affordable
review.reviewText: Consistent with all other DoubleTree hotels. Nice room. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The outside of the hotel looks a bit dated. Parking is expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Access to public transportation to downtown SF, the airport, and downtown Burlingame is available, if you don't want to drive or don't have a car.

review.reviewText: Was happy with our room, was very comfortable and clean.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Conviniently located near major attractions... Napa Valley, Sonoma, etc.

review.title: Great restaurant great cocktails!
review.reviewText: Good value! Hotel As expected. With a great restaurant on site!

review.title: Nice hotel, clean rooms, nice open lobby.
review.reviewText: Love staying along the bay front. Close to BART, close to shopping and nice restaurants. Great Bay Trail for working out.
review.positiveRemarks: I love the newly remodeled hotel. Rooms and lobby are a great improvement. Staff was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Always dislike paying for parking.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, dinning, mass transit, airplane watching, bay front walking.

review.title: great for a getaway
review.reviewText: I stayed there with a friend the night before the Diva Half Marathon. The room was very luxurious - comfy bed, very clean and plenty of natural light. The hotel staff was awesome and super helpful. A total surprise bonus was the free breakfast buffet that opened at 6 AM (we were able to get some oatmeal and a banana before the run) and we were able to grab breakfast after the run too!

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Great hotel while travelling. Close to airport with great shuttle service and close to a lovely town with great dining and shopping. Also those cookies!!

Staff was great especially ,Philip, he stored our bags because we arrived early in the morning .He also arrainged the car rental company to come and pick us up at the hotel. Philip made us feel very comfortable during our stay, the hilton should give him a raise .
Check-in was real fast and the cookies were hot and delicious.

review.title: Good single night stay
review.reviewText: Stayed at Double Tree for one night in order to catch an early flight the next morning. Thought I got a great rate at $99/night, but then needed to pay $5/hour or $22/day for parking. Still great rate for a very nice hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice rooms, clean, newer. Hilton Honors rooms are very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of the parking fee.

review.title: $22 Parking?????
review.reviewText:
Everything was ok except $22 parking that we were not notified until showed up on my credit card bill. I choose this hotel just because it was cheaper then other hotels around Fishermen wharf. If I had to pay $22 more on parking I would have choose the hotel near fishermen wharf.
Will not stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Please notify guest before charging guest credit card. Please mention on your website that parking is $22.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Okay, great breakfast.
review.reviewText: Got in late, front desk was very confused. Shuttle was great.

review.title: Nice layover
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel for a layover I would definitely stay there again

review.title: The hotel staff was awesome
review.reviewText: I really appreciated the staff, they went out of their way to make sure we were satisfied with our stay.
Location was great, great view of the airport and city behind it. Room was clean and comfortable. Great bar, and delicious cookies!

review.title: Convenient to Airport
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with easy access to the airport and nearby restaurants in Burlingame and Milbrae. Could use a lower cost option for breakfast.

review.title: Close to Airport and BART
review.reviewText: We were only there one night but it was very pleasant. Shuttle service frequent and made it easy to take BART to the city for a nice evening. Excellent choice for us because we had an early flight out the next morning.

review.title: Ok place. Slow service at front desk.
review.reviewText: Not bad. Newly remodeled. Rusty is a great bartender. Super slow front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Speed up front desk in all aspects: check in, questions, to buy a water
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport and by nice running path

review.title: Nice view.
review.reviewText: Overall hotel is nice. Good and safe location. Rooms are in great condition. Staff was not very welcoming. They taxed me for everything. Price that was initially stated was not close to what I ended up paying unfortunately.

review.title: Great airport location
review.reviewText: This hotel was an awesome experience. We only stayed one night before boarding our cruise. The staff were excellent in professionalism and friendliness. The food in the restaurant was great value for the dollar. There is not a bad thing we can say about this facility. Really enjoyed our one night here.

review.title: Decide with "built year" not photos.
review.reviewText: Not to mention the hotel, Expedia lost a lot of credit.

review.title: Spring Break Fly out!
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel based on price and close proximity to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: SMELL
review.locationRemarks: Can walk along bay trail.

review.title: Great airport location
review.reviewText: Very comfy beds, nice pillows. Very clean rooms and easy access to airport. Always love Doubletrees and this one is no exception.

Nice hotel by the bay
Very clean ,

The room keys did not function
But we had another one so no worries
I would definetly stay another time
For this hotel being close to train station and airport I did not hear anything

review.title: It was ok, parking was expensive

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Stayed the might before our flight. Excellent hotel, with free shuttle to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds were way to soft for us, could not get a pleasant sleep. Need to have some firmer beds, at least on some rooms.

review.title: Front desk not polite
review.reviewText: Front desk not polite, loves to argue with guest. Doesn't know timing for airport shuttle bus. Shuttle bus drivers not clear about Hilton at Burlingame nor Hilton North. Is NOT Hilton that I know for years.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel for a night or two for business travels

review.title: So-so
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice. Very comfortable beds- but small. Walls were paper thin. You could even hear alarm clock going off in the room next to us at 3:50 am. Also you could hear all of the planes all night. Staff wS friendly and rooms were clean.

review.title: Nice Hotel. Conflict with Expedia room size offer
review.reviewText:
We booked a room for 5. But the assigned room had only 2 double beds.
We had paid extra for the 5th passenger but the hotel tried to charge for it again. Finally they decided not to.

When they bring the extra bed it barely entered in the room and it made a sofa and desk impossible to use.

We complain with the Front Desk and Manager but they replied that Expedia was wrong assigning such a small room as for 5 passengers. I called Expedia but they respond that the hotel was offering these rooms for 5.

End of story: neither of them took any responsibility and we had to pack ourselves in such a small place.

review.title: One Night in SFO
review.reviewText: I have stayed at several hotels in that immediate vicinity and this one was the nicest.
review.negativeRemarks: Free parking. I did not realize until I got there that there was a $22 per day charge. I just overlooked that information.

review.title: Very friendly staff
review.reviewText: The staff was very warm and welcoming! Rusty the bartender derserves an A+ for his job! He makes the best mojitos and was Very entertaining!!

review.title: Everyone was very friendly!
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent from check-in to check-out. It was a very busy weekend and the hotel was full. The staff in the restaurant was excellent too! Every time we walked by something they were cheerful and all smiles! The room was very nice, clean and comfortable! Definitely worth the price! Oh, my son loved the cookies :)
review.positiveRemarks: One of the best hotel fitness centers I have seen! Definitely very useful.
review.locationRemarks: When I travel to the San Francisco area I always choose to stay by the airport because we love the views of the bay and enjoy the walking/running path

review.title: Best part are the free warm cookies at check in!
review.reviewText:
Pros- warm cookies, comfy bed, and clean bathroom.

Cons- toilet flushed too slow, wet stain on the wall, dusty lamps, and our hotel key did not work right. We stood outside our door while the maid tried to get us in for almost 20 minutes.

review.title: Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel - Doubletree advertises their fresh warm cookies - however, there were none offered to us or even available.
review.positiveRemarks: Good for our one night stay when we arrived to San Francisco late at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Cookies!
review.locationRemarks: have no idea

review.title: Housekeeping
review.reviewText: Housekeeping knocked on our door at 10:30 pm and 11 pm to deliver another bed that we didn't ask for. We were asleep and got woken up twice when needed to be up in early am 5:30am. Not thrilled about poor comunication on hotel staff side.

review.title: a good hotel.
review.reviewText: it is nice. not far away from the airport. drive quite easily, about 30 minutes to the downtown.

review.title: Problem solved
review.reviewText:
There was initially a glitch over the price quoted by Expedia, but the issue was expeditiously
resolved. My entire experience was one to "write home about". This was my first hotel reservation through Expedia - you've got my appreciation, future business, and as much positive publicity as I can send your way.
review.negativeRemarks: The receptionists failed to mention hotel amenities e.g. Happy hour, gym, pool,restaurant etc.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect and the "park and fly" price and arrangement gets my highest marks

review.title: Fair but overpriced for what they offer
review.reviewText: The hotel had multiple light fixtures that did not work. In addition it did not have sun shielding curtains that could close all the way to cover the window. The room itself was cleaned but those few things made such a difference in my comfort there.

We were greeted with a warm chocolate chip cookie and a friendly, helpful staff. The room was very pleasant, but even more importantly, it was quiet - something I did not expect in a hotel adjacent to the airport. The bed was relatively firm and the towels were actually soft!
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and quiet and the free airport shuttle service came exactly when we were told it would.
review.negativeRemarks: Better lighting for reading. And if there was a refridgerator, I did not see it.
review.locationRemarks: We only were here overnight to catch a plane.

review.title: Airport delay stay over
review.reviewText:
Our flight was cancelled so we caught shuttle to hotel and next morning they took us back for our flight
They made it easy and convenient

review.title: Very Nice Hotel, but Extra's shouldn't Cost You
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel with pleasant staff and very up to date. We had no problems checking in or out. We even received cookies upon our arrival.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked having a view of the ocean and it was nice to receive cookies when we arrived.
review.negativeRemarks: Unless you have valet parking, a guest of your hotel should not have to pay for parking. That's ridiculous!!

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean and nice, check in was fast and very polite. its does not include breakfast and you have to paid for parking fee. double bed kind of small for two people. Other than that everything else was perfect. I like it.
review.negativeRemarks: Should include breakfast and parking fee.
review.locationRemarks: Nice view and close to the park.

review.title: Very nice airport hotel.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the DoubleTree Hilton for 1 night at the end of our 12 day California vacation. We dropped our car at the airport and took the shuttle to the hotel. Lobby area is very open, with the dining room and bar open to the the rest of lobby area but separated by greenery, etc.. Very pretty hotel. We were on the Honors floor and room was a large and comfortable for our family of 4 with a huge bathroom. Beds were very comfortable. Staff was very friendly. Took the shuttle from the hotel to airport very early the next morning. Shuttle runs every 15 minutes. Very pleasant experience. Our first stay at a DoubleTree Hilton and we were very happy withit.
review.negativeRemarks: Probably silly request, but we would have loved popcorn or peanuts while sitting at the bar having a drink. Larger bar menu.
review.locationRemarks: Airport hotel but nice area. You could out and walk along the water.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel, but the shuttle service to the airport needs to be improved. It was a cold night and I waited at the airport for over 30 minutes for the shuttle. There were several flight attendants who waited longer than me. The hotel has to fix this problem soon. The food is good there and they did have some entertainment on a Saturday night.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service
review.locationRemarks: Take the shuttle to SFO to reach the BART station. You can go downtown from there

review.title: Poor over charge my credict car $27.00 dollar

review.title: convenience

review.title: Nice,

review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport with free shuttle and trolley service.

review.title: Nice hotel close to SFO airport

review.title: Very nice hotel, convenient to the airport.

our experience was very nice

Thanks

review.title: Fees everywhere, not a good value
review.reviewText: 2 nights with the family. Room was clean but small. It was 20$ a night to park my car at the hotel I already payed to stay at. I asked about alternative parking but the staff told me there was no alternative even if I was willing to go blocks away to save 40$ for the 2 nights. This is not downtown San Francisco where parking is scare, there's open space all over the place not to mention their own lot was 50% vacant. No free coffee downstairs, no free WiFi. I drove off after our stay with a sour taste in my mouth. Nothing whatsoever impressive or cool about it. It was like a 75$ motel 6 without the free breakfast or parking or coffee or wifi, only I paid 140$ +tax +city tax. I really expected more.
review.negativeRemarks: don't violate me for the parking. Don't nickel and dime me for WiFi, Coffee etc.

review.title: Helpful staff, clean, quiet room.

They connected the shuttle, the BART, and the hop-on-hop-off bus route for me, and kept my bags safe for the day after I checked out. I hope I can stay there again soon.
review.positiveRemarks: The pillows, the shower, and the service.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.

review.title: Convenient

review.positiveRemarks: close to airport, view of the bay.

review.title: OK hotel, close to airport
review.reviewText: We stayed here for two nights while visiting San Fran before heading to the national parks. The hotel is OK. I was surprised that there was a charge for WiFi. The one good thing was the shuttle. We used this a lot to connect to public transportation.

review.title: Airport hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed here the last night of a vacation to be close to the airport. The room in the renovated part was mostly great, nice king bed, nice shower and big room. We enjoyed the Bay Walk across the street- rarely can you get exercise in such a pleasant way at a hotel. Negatives were the dining room was understaffed for dinner and as a result, the waiter was visibly upset and didn't check back on his tables. The food was good however. We then left the door tag for room service breakfast outside as requested only it was never picked up. We called and got the order with the wrong juice, and no knives to use with the butter! Overpriced as well, and everything such as internet was extra. Final note - the inside of the windows was dirty.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, convenience. Added plus was the Bay Walk right across the street, excellent walking and biking path along the bay.
review.negativeRemarks: Service issues: dinner was understaffed, Room service got the breakfast wrong (minor) and didn't come automatically.
review.locationRemarks: Bay Walk great. Not much else nearby, other hotels.

review.title: Airport Overnight
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable. Staff pleasant. Shuttle reliable and fast. Only issue was that the AC was loud and ineffective.

review.title: Nice staff...awesome restaurant ...
review.reviewText: Staff was great...restaurant was awesome so were cookies. Had a leaky air conditioner in room..388.. Hope u fixed it...was a puddle... The shuttle service was excellent..overall...if room would have been a smidgen cleaner would have been perfect. Noticed floors didn't get vacuumed.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning conditions..bathrooms on main floor had a bad smell daily coming out in the hallway
review.locationRemarks: Everything we wanted to do...Candlestick Park and Fishermans Wharf were close

review.title: Great hotel, but the checkin process was a problem
review.reviewText:
So I got to this hotel and there were about 300 Japanese exchange students in the lobby making so much noise I didn't know what to do. I was also fighting my way to the front desk with about 30 airline employees. Long story short, it was crazy busy, but this might have been because it was also running a promotional discount and was the cheapest hotel I could find close to the airport. Anyway, so I get to the front desk after having booked with Expedia and the guy at the check in desk tries to look me up...

"Sorry, I don't have your reservation.", he says. So there I am, sick as a dog, in a loud lobby, fumbling around with my cell phone to try to prove to him that, yes, I did reserve this hotel. Does he go out of his way to look at the printed reservations, no? Meanwhile, I'm standing there just waiting for him to figure his stuff out, fumbling on my phone, showing him the receipt, and other front desk people are going out of the way to welcome guests. Doubletree does this thing where they hand you a warmed cookie on check-in - now I don't need a cookie, but I am hungry. And, five minutes go I'm still standing there with a somewhat standoffish guy telling me he doesn't know anything about my reservation...

...he goes to check the printer in a cursory manner. Tells me nothing is there, finally another agent says, is this is? Guy just missed it - didn't make me feel welcome, and I didn't get a cookie. Bad service, crowded hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were OK. Room service was edible.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, over-crowding. The airport shuttle is unpredictable.
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: nice hotel. convenient to airport
review.reviewText: one night stay near airport for flight out next day. convenient, clean, friendly staff. quiet and clean rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: free shuttle to airport that ran every 20 minutes. In-house restaurant and bar, good and reasonable buffet breakfast.

review.title: Good location, airport shuttle very timely
review.reviewText: Lovely view of the bay. We were upgraded to a renovated room which was nice. The bathroom was awesome. I only wish there had been a pool outdoors on the first level.
review.negativeRemarks: A pool

review.title: Dont stay here - save $$$. Consider Best Western
review.reviewText:
We booked 4 adults+1 child and the reservation said "adjoining rooms"
However, when we checked in, the hotel told us there is no such thing as adjoining rooms so we were cramped into a very small room. It was only for one night, but it did cost $289. Also, the checkin person told us we'd be in the back of the hotel since its been renovated. However, the bathroom ceiling had a 4 inch opening, a gash. Lastly, we asked for 2 towels and an hour went by, and I had to call again. The next 2 nights, we decided to stay at the Best Western, El Rancho, which is in Millbrae, literally 5 min ride to the airport. Very nice staff, breakfast, and 50% of the cost of DT. Have shuttle to airport.

review.title: Loved the cookies.... I'm hooked!
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time. The room was large and comfortable. Loved the proximity to the bay.
review.negativeRemarks: cost
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Classy and clean

review.title: Close to the airport and very nice
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice and close to the airport but also quite expensive. They charged an extra $20 to park overnight. I would gladly trade some luxuries for free parking...
review.negativeRemarks: Too expensive, especially charging for parking and an extra bed for a child.

review.title: Watch out for those hidden fees!
review.reviewText: The DoubleTree was everything I expected and am used to getting at such a quality hotel....excellent staff, great room, great location. What took me for surprise here was the 9.95 a day internet charge (for my room) and the 20.00 a day parking. Because I needed both that's an extra $30 a day just to stay here. I won't be staying here again because I know I can beat the price for the same room anywhere else in Burlingame. The DoubleTree in Colorado doesn't charge for these hidden fees, why do you? Rhetorical question...no need to answer!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything except having to pay for internet and parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Waive the fees on internet and parking.

review.title: Great Free local trolley and airport shuttle bus
review.reviewText:
It was a good thing we stayed at an airport hotel which has got a live display of flights as we found out that our flight back home was delayed by 3 hours before BA emailed us; we spent a lovely afternoon in downtown Burlingame where a FREE local trolley took us, checking out their good ranged restaurants and shops instead of being stuck at an airport terminal.

In face, we've used an airport shuttle bus (+ BART) to do some site-seeing in downtown as well and been convinced that it was much better to stay here than downtown hotels that charge double the price.
We enjoyed a quiet morning walk/run along the bay just outside the hotel without a crowd nor homeless people that you can't avoid in downtown.

comfortable room, beds, clean bathroom, attentive staff (thanks for your hard solo work managing a busy weekend evening bar; sorry I forgot your name) on top of the location. I was a happy customer.

Watch out for those yummy welcome cookies - I suggest you take a look at an energy and fat content before you eat it. I needed to use their 24hour gym!

review.title: Great hotel after or before a long flight

We ordered room service for breakfast - save the money, food was so so and OVERPRICED! Good place to stay, felt it was worth the price. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

But we wasted most of one afternoon getting on it in stead on the Ballingame shuttle. Which seemed to be a secret for some reason. The room was lovely and clean everyday. Friendly helpful maids. The down side to the hotel was no fridge. We had no place to keep insulin cool, so ended up using lots of ice from ice machine. The restaurant food was very limited but always good. In fact delicious. The service was VERY slow, . If you are in a hurry better make other arrangements.

The hotel was decent. The room itself was pretty standard. I prefer firm mattresses, so I was not a huge fan of the softer mattress offered.

The restaurant was pretty good. I had both dinner and breakfast there and was more than pleased with the quality of the food and service. Other amenities, like the airport shuttle, made this a very convenient stay.

review.title: Reasonable.
review.reviewText:
Typical Hotel for business travellers, the rooms have two double beds that are not very comfortable. The proximity to the incoming airplanes is quite loud. Take off during the night can be rather alarming if your not a deep sleeper.
The parking lot arrangement is a load of hassle if you have to pass through one of the ticket machine dispensing areas.
The rooms were clean, easy access to the 101 and 15 minutes into the Tourist area of San Francisco.
The flight attendants and pilots arrive and depart at all hours and can be quite noisy, lots of door slamming.
review.negativeRemarks: Proximity to incoming Airplanes.
review.locationRemarks: Too noisy.

It only takes you to the airport!
