review.reviewText: I came to San Francisco to visit a friend. I try to find a Doubletree everywhere I go. I love the hotel, the services and prices.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed is one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in outside of my own.

review.title: Shuttle workers are rude!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Our hotel experience for the first time being in San Francisco was great except the Shuttle workers. I understand the shuttle service was free & that their job is to pick up & drop off but regard less there needs to be a sense of common courtesy. We were there three days & the first day they were rude & I just thought it was because it was early in the morning. The next day we were going to catch the Bart Transit & the shuttle driver said ketch the next one & shut the door on us when we were right in front of the door. I am not a complainer or anything as of that nature but someone needs to have a interpersonal communication training with these shuttle drivers. The shuttle is a courtesy & no one owes them anything or do they owe us but courtesy. Thanks for your time.
review.positiveRemarks: Front Desk Workers are very nice
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport but far from everything else

review.title: Great hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: Only stayed for 6 hours to catch an early flight but clean, hospitable and steady shuttle service

review.title: Good value with convenient facilities for the airp
review.reviewText: Great value for money and super convenient. Even a trip into the city is easy with the airport shuttle taking you to the BART station
review.negativeRemarks: Slightly old bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for the airport

review.title: Pleasing hotel and waiter's customer service skill
review.reviewText: Jesus, your waiter in the restaurant, remembered us from our one-night stopover 3 weeks prior, seated us at the same booth as before and even knew what we like to drink!!! Made a recommendation for dinner that was excellent. By the way, my husband and I each had only one drink on our prior visit, so think Jesus has an excellent memory and wonderful customer service skills.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle to the nearby airport and Jesus, your waiter

review.title: great place right off the airport....
review.reviewText: Although there was a big party coming in when we were (and they were kind of rude) the front desk staff was very pleasant and very friendly and very helpful. Specifically with getting a rental car for the next day. I had been very sick on the flight over (from Boston) so I was very very grateful to be in such a comfortable big bed to literally just crash in once we got to our room. would def recommend to others. :)

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The hotel needs an overall makeover for the doubletree brand. Pretty disappointing and depressing. My room wreaked of the kitchen's exhaust smell. The parking cards never worked for the three days I was there though they've changed the park/room card the first time I complained.

review.title: Graet hotel in San Francisco, California
review.reviewText: This hotel was simply wonderful. The staff was awesome. We really enjoyed our stay. The only thing we didn't like was the $20.00 per day parking fee.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking Fee
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to Airport and right off of the 101 Freeway

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I really liked the hotel, it was a little out of the way but very nice. I liked being close to the airport and there was water nearby. I walked one day and it was very nice. The staff is friendly, the room was comfortable, and we asked for a mini fridge and they provided it. We had a very nice vacation.

review.title: Updated, modern hotel right on the Bay.
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautifully updated, clean, and very comfortable. We used the fitness room and enjoyed strolling on the nearby Bay shore walkway, too. The downsides were paying for parking ($20/day) and wireless internet charges ($9.99).

review.title: 4 star hotel!
review.reviewText: Although some of the staff had little knowledge of activities in the surrounding areas, it was a 4 star hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints.
review.locationRemarks: Too far from the city.

review.title: Good quality hotel with friendly staff
review.reviewText:
Good quality hotel with friendly staff. The room is clean and functional and tastefully decorated. Close proximity to SFO airport, so very convenient for stopover stays. Would stay there again if I need to be in the area.
Also tried the restaurant, had a nice and tender roast chicken breast with reasonable price.
review.locationRemarks: Close proximity to SFO airport

review.title: disappointing
review.reviewText: I got to the hotel in the evening when there was only one person running the front desk and there was a line of 5 people behind me. The room that was guaranteed as a king standard was not available and I had to settle for 2 double beds. The service was slow and the front desk clerk was unapologetic that the promised room was not delivered. I was too tired to argue since it had taken 20 minutes just to check in and there was a line of people waiting to hear the same news. Very disappointing. Also, know that there is a nightly parking charge of $20.

review.title: Don't go there!
review.reviewText: The bed was good and the sheets were clean. The carpet was dirty--it looked oily. There was a dead cricket on the floor. Dishes (not mine) were left outside the door overnight.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty.
review.locationRemarks: Good location. The airport shuttle was on time.

review.title: Hidden Agenda....
review.reviewText:
Everything except for $9.95 Internet fee , and $20 per night parking was outragous. If DD Hilton had fixed this, it would be great. However, its not wroth to stay here all these hidden fees and no contoenental breakfast or complimentary coffee and tea anywhere. Cookie touch at the front desk was a good idea. But, confusing offerings and not pleasing hidden costs.

Make your own mind...

review.title: one of the worst
review.reviewText: server sucks. really bad attitude. rooms kinda dirty. one of my worst experiences.

review.title: Well located to airport but thats it.
review.reviewText: The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We had an early flight with young children this hotel was close to airport with airport shuttle leaving every 15mins. The resturant was very nice and clean with frienly staff and reasonable prices considering nothing else around.
review.negativeRemarks: Found a ladies top left in room from previous guests.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to airport 10mins

review.title: Great hotel for a family
review.reviewText: Nice stay in a nice hotel with a nice view of the bay

review.title: Comfortable Stay
review.reviewText: Was a short but comfortable stay - as you would hope for an airport hotel.

review.title: Great for airport layover
review.reviewText: For the price compared to other nearby hotels, we found this place a good value and very nice hotel. The only problem we had, which we did not report, due to our extremely short stay (we were slated to leave at 4:00am and didn't want to bother switching rooms) was that the toilet line to fill the tank must have been pinched or clogged, as it took a long time to refill--so we refilled it manually, Other than that, the place was impeccable and staff very friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Near the water, nice walks and restaurant (Kincaids) nearby

review.title: Get more for your $ elsewhere
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel due to its proximity to the airport, and the shuttle was good. Being a family of 5 we had limited choices available for 1 room in this location. However the Internet was only free in the lobby, and we had to go down and ask the staff to supply the roll out bed. My kids were sent to the building next door to use their pool then were told it was shut once they got there. Having spent the past 3 weeks staying at Comfort / Best Western etc I wonder why anyone would stay at a place that charges double and offers much less. No breakfast, pool or room internet, room not any better than those in cheaper hotel chains.
review.positiveRemarks: Transfer bus good, warm cookie on arrival
review.negativeRemarks: Price, lack of breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Good for airport

review.title: Great ouutbound location from SFO
review.reviewText:
The front desk was helpful with both arrival and departure. The genaral manger gave us directions to downtown and made reservations at a resturant that we wanted to go. even
The business center was a nice touch to answer emails and make your advance check in helpful for the airport.
Again, nice experience.
review.locationRemarks: Great if you are flying out of SFO

review.title: Never again.
review.reviewText: My experience was not favorable. There were problems with the plumbing, when we asked to change rooms, the reply was there was nothing available.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast and the fee for wifi.
review.locationRemarks: Obscure

review.title: great hotel for short visit to SF
review.reviewText: Good quality hotel, with shuttle service close to the SF airport. Staff was very courteous. I liked the breakfast who was reasonably priced.
review.negativeRemarks: outside architecture

review.title: Good hotel with great restaurant.
review.reviewText:
Terrific restaurant . Great roasted tomato soup and octopus salad.
Very good waiter.

review.title: Great for SFO airport users
review.reviewText: Conveniently located near the airport. Shuttle service to the airport every 15minutes was great. Rate was reasonable. Wi fi internet was not free in the room but at the lobby area.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Would have been nice to have a refrigerator. $16.99 for a movie rental is too much.

review.title: Don't miss the Bay Trail
review.reviewText: Fluffy towels, good water pressure in shower, comfortable beds. All the things that are important in a hotel. The bar is comfortable for reading or surfing the internet while having a drink. Restaurant food was very good. The Bay Trail in front of the restaurant is a must see if you stay here. Beautiful view of San Francisco Bay. I would stay here again.

review.title: Bad experience!
review.reviewText: On the second day we noticed that the floor was wet near the window. I reported it and we went out for the day. When we came back there was this hugh fan blowing on the carpet, very noisy. We turned it off and maintenance came and picked it up, floor was still a little damp. Won't stay there again, they didn't do anything for us for the inconvenience we suffered.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Easy access to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, all modes of transportation, and great restaurants. Great value and great location. Will stay here next time in SF.

review.title: Great for Business or Family
review.reviewText: Easy access to the 101 so less than twenty minutes to downtown San Francisco. Safe and clean with friendly and helpfull staff.

review.title: Nice Place for the Price
review.reviewText: The room was nice other than a faint smell of mildew when we first arrived, probably from the AC not running for a bit, but that cleared up. Comfortable bed and clean bathroom. The restaurant is really good, we had both breakfast and lunch there and enjoyed it. The free shuttle to and from the airport is really convenient and saved us a bunch of money getting into the city using the BART. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great find near SF airport
review.reviewText:
Great price near SF airport.
Staff eager to help and very accommodating.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the Hotel. Would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Atmosphere. The beds were nice, no back ache.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport.

review.title: Close to the Airport
review.reviewText: Great location for easy access to the airport. We used the complimentary shuttle service for transportation to and from the airport for our international flight. The room was very comfortable and clean. Staff was most helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Just minutes by free shuttle from the airport.

review.title: good deal
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, staff friendly, easy transportation to airport
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: great if you need to get to the airport

review.title: Quality hotel
review.reviewText: Front desk staff was very courteous. Quality decor. Did not want to pay for parking so I parked in the empty lot across the street. Hotel is right on the bay, near a walking trail.
review.negativeRemarks: Room decor was a little too dark for my tastes

review.title: "Great service and food. Decent rooms"
review.reviewText: We stayed one night at this hotel and overall, it was quite nice. The shuttle was at the airport waiting for us and promptly took us directly to our hotel. Check-in went smoothly. We arrived rather late at night and our only option for food was in the lounge. It was a Saturday night and we were the only ones eating besides people at the bar. Our server/bartender was very attentive and the food was wonderful--very fresh and cooked to order. We couldn't have been happier with the quality and service. The next morning, we ate breakfast in the restaurant and again, the service was very attentive and pleasant. I thought the breakfast buffet was very good--an excellent assortment of items. My husband ordered the Eggs Benedict and raved about it. My only negative comment was the room was a bit dusty around the baseboards (no one else noticed it but me, but then again, I look for this stuff#, and the beds were quite small for my husband and me #and we're not big people), but we were definitely crowded. Overall, it was perfect for one night and the food aspect was exceptional. The shuttle in the morning back to the airport was prompt and efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: Dusty room, felt a tad bit old"
review.locationRemarks: The location was excellent. Convenient to airport. No noise."

review.title: Comfy beds.
review.reviewText: Easy check-in, beds were comfy. Close to where we needed to be. We had a bay view room. Hotel staff were nice and accomodating. I did expect a refrigerator and microwave as standard amenities but this room didn't come with one. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Good all around hotel
review.reviewText: The room was nice, clean and a comfortable size. The elevators were inadequate. One was not working so the other one was extremely slow. We ended up taking the sevice elevator, it was very prompt.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle service was very prompt and the drivers were great.
review.locationRemarks: The location near the airport is good.

review.title: good Hotel.
review.reviewText:
The staff at the Lounge was very efficient.
Parking fee is a little overkill.

review.title: Extra charges
review.reviewText: WiFi isn't free. This is 2012, it's hard to reconcile charging for internet service. Parking in a lot that was never full was $18 per day. The room fee should be adjusted to include amenities rather than charging the customer when they arrive and realize there's not another option.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the bay, very nice for a late-night stroll

review.title: Comfortable stay
review.reviewText: I stayed one night at the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. The food at the hotel was very good. It was a great place to stay.

review.title: quick stop
review.reviewText: Have to pay for parking. Otherwise very comfortable

review.title: Great stop close to Sfo Airport
review.reviewText:
very nice rooms, bar and restaurant.
Great service
Shuttle to Airport

review.title: Worst SFO Hilton Choice
review.reviewText:
This hotel is awful. Don't book it. It was advertised via Expedia w/complimentary breakfast and no parking fee; I booked as such several months ago, only to be hit upon arrival late July, breakfast charge suddenly now $15! daily parking charge $18!! Plus fleas in the room apparently held only for Expedia guests and guests w/pets.

Really bad desk-staff attitude was "tense." Aggressively non-accommodating desk "manager" informed us that, (quote): "This business-hotel, not vacation hotel!!"

Remodeling of lobby turned lobby/bar/reastaurant into one big, huge "gymnasium" of a place . . .loud all the time . . . if you are in the corner of the dining room, you still are going to hear the arriving 50-student-tour groups and the so-called "acid jazz" pumped constantly on the sound system over the bar. . . . ."Worst choice" hotel/Burlingame. . . . you can do better!!
review.negativeRemarks: fleas in room; loud dining room; surly desk clerk...

review.title: Awesome hotel!
review.reviewText: The staff at the Double Tree really goes out of their way to make you feel at home and that you are number 1 in their book!!!! Awesome hotel.

review.title: Construction, Overpriced Parking & Decent Room
review.reviewText: Hotel is under some major construction. Be aware of the $18 charge per day for parking. Service was fair. No creamer in the business lounge where there was complimentary coffee. Walked to the front desk to get some... none there. I was sent to the restaurant. Finally got some creamer. It sure seemed like a lot of walking for a shot of cream. Overall... decent stay. Great walkway across the street from the hotel. Enjoyed that!
review.negativeRemarks: Construction and Expensive Parking

review.title: Didn't sleep well due to thin walls!
review.reviewText: The room next door kept banging the wall to our room and our neighbor kept on partying all night which kept us from sleeping well. This Hotel needs to redo all the walls!!!

review.title: hotel stay
review.reviewText: The reason I gave it a 4 was they have contruction going on. and its a hasle getting to one of the towers. That's where my room was located.

review.title: Disappointing....
review.reviewText: This is not your typical Doubletree. Felt more like a Holiday Inn or something. Those aren't bad Hotels but don't get your expectations up that your getting a Doubletree sort of experience. In general it felt "dirty" and that had nothing to do with the construction. Help getting your bags in and out the Hotel was almost non-existent. They also make you pay for parking which is rediculous considering that your well outside of the City. I travel all over the world and have never come across that before!

review.title: Nasty Hotel
review.reviewText: We called the Hotel for directions and the person was very rude to start with, so I hung up and stopped and got directions from the Holiday Inn Express(Which by the way was much nicer as it turned out). Then we get to the Hotel and it is under renovation and things are a mess. We checked in and unloaded, then went to return our rental car to find that we had to pay to leave the lot. We went inside and the same rude person whom you could hardly understand would not validate our ticket. We were there less than 30 minutes, I thought this was pretty bad. The smell in the hotel was not very appealing from the renovation, I guess a mixture of dirty carpet and trash. The person who helped us unload our car was very helpful, but he was the only one. We paid for a bay view but you could only see the bay if you walked to the window and looked hard to your right.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel staff was horrible. They also need to find at least one employee who can speek clear English.
review.locationRemarks: The location was good for someone needing to go to the airport.

review.title: Remodeling Underway
review.reviewText: Hotel under renovation. All services are in temporary locations.

review.title: Enjoyable Stay
review.reviewText: The front desk was professional and courteous. The room was nice. Everything contributed to a brief, but pleasant stay.

review.title: Under renovation
review.reviewText:
The hotel was under renovation. IMO they should shut down hotels under renovation, rather than having guests figure out paths and inaccessible floors. They say that Expedia had a clear message about this. This cannot be correct, because I had plenty of choice in where I wanted to stay in the bay area and I would happily have picked one that wasn't undergoing renovation.
Also, they could at least have waived some of the extra costs: $18 per night to park the car is too much in that area IMO. Same goes for $10 for night and per device (!!!!) for the WiFi connection. IMO hotel south of SFO should all have WiFi included in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: under renovation, expensive WiFi, expensive parking
review.locationRemarks: good launch pad for meetings throughout SF and the bay area

review.title: Could be better
review.reviewText: Remodeling incomplete at time of stay. Some lights in room do not work. Paint stains wrecked clean look in bath vanity.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodeled room should have lights that work. Paid a little more but felt like I was at a cut rate hotel
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Nice room, however, additional fees charged
review.reviewText: Our room was very nice. My favorite was the bed. It had a pillowtop mattress.I slept 12 hours that night!. However, there were additional fees to our room we were not prepared with. A parking fee of $18 dollars. In addition there were fees that were charged on our credit card for $14 and $50. We still need to research them and check to see why we were charged. We did not use any of the additional items in the room. They were also doing reconstruction so it was a little difficult to get to our rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Fees charged to hotel room.
review.locationRemarks: Located close To SF airport.The ocean was across the street. We took a walk down the pathway by the beach. It was very nice.

review.title: No Thanks
review.reviewText: The lobby is under construction for remodeling. The restaurant is in a meeting room. The bar is in a meeting room. Even at that the prices for a drink were very high. In general, virtually no effort was made to mitigate the inconvenience of the remodeling. Even their world famous cookies were a bit on the stale side. I sometimes forget that I should avoid Hilton products. Then, as in this case, I am freshly reminded.
review.negativeRemarks: Construction without warning.

review.title: Disapointed
review.reviewText: We were disapointed that the hotel was under construction! We were not told in advance... parking was not good, hall ways were very dirty because of construction. The dining room and bar/lounge were moved into temporary rooms and didnt feel warm and welcoming! And the "Starbucks" was just a small cart for some coffee... we were also told by the front desk when we checked in that we may not want to stay in our rooms from 9am to 6 pm because of the noise from the construction!
review.positiveRemarks: The bed and pillows were very comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: getting to our room
review.locationRemarks: ok location...

review.title: Terrible! Terrible! Terrible!
review.reviewText: I know I booked a room a this place at the last minute on a holiday weekend however I was very disappointed when I arrived to the place under construction - did I say Holiday weekend? The entrance to the hotel was set up in the back. The regular restaurant was moved to another room and tables were outside in the hall. I was warmly welcomed by staff. The staff was always helpful and attentive. They did mention when I arrived that the room in which I was staying had been freshly remodeled. I had no idea it was probably yesterday! The original room had such a bad smell from new carpet I had to switch rooms. The new room had the smell of fresh paint! The rooms right next door to these rooms was incomplete- they didn't finish in time with the remodel to stick someone in there. I was able to tolerate the smell of paint only after having the maintenance man come up to the room and fix the ac/ heat. Fortunately by the time I was done eating out at a restaurant the smell had cleared enough to sleep. I've stayed here 2 times before and had high expectations to it being as good as before. Very very disappointed and will probably not go back! Good thing I was not trying to impress a significant other. I would not have let this go so easily!
review.negativeRemarks: under construction!!!!!!!!!!!
review.locationRemarks: close to NB & SB 101.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: All sites should have updates on construction and remodeling. Access to the lobby and rooms was difficult and extremely noisy during the day with jackhammering and other loud construction noises. Shower controls were extremely hard to operate - could barely pull on. Directions to the site were poor and the waiting area for the shuttle was placed next to the smoking area. Hotel was also located MUCH farther from the airport and the city of San Francisco than expected. Cab ride back to hotel from city was over $65.00. Buffet breakfast was only fair and was over $10.00 per person. Other hotels in area offer free breakfast with rooms. If I had known all this - I would NOT have stayed at this hotel....and will not stay with this chain again.

review.title: Good Value Near SFO
review.reviewText: The new renovation is very nice and a much needed upgrade. The hotel was never shabby but the old look was dated. Staff is always cheerful and pleasant. Restaurant is good and room service is very good. I stay here every month for 3-4 days and have never been dissatisfied.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee of $18.00 per day! Kind of pricey!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Doubletree to the rescue
review.reviewText: Had a bad experience with a car rental but talked to a very sympathetic lady at the hotel. Since I was unable to come to any compromise with the car rental people I needed to find an alternate plan. The lady I talked to at Doubletree told me about a shuttle bus that ran from SFO to Petaluma and then took a cab from there to Sonoma. What could have been a total disaster was turned around due to the help that I received from her. When I checked in the people at the front desk were a little cold though. My first impression was that this hotel had seen better days. The room was very clean and comfortable though and I got a really good nights sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: Help I received from Paula and enjoyed a comfortable, clean, relaxing room.
review.negativeRemarks: People at front desk were not friendly or welcoming.
review.locationRemarks: Seemed to be fairly close to airport.

review.title: Restfull night
review.reviewText:
Great bed, very good sound insulation, close to the airport, professional and courteous staff.
Will use this hotel again.

review.title: Pleased
review.reviewText: Great. The service was terrific in the restaurant - Jesus was great.

review.title: Observations
review.reviewText: Very convenient to SFO airport. Food service and quality was excellent. Front desk staff was very helpful.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Had a layover between flights, we stayed at the Doubletree Airport. We arrived late so we checked in and found a bite to eat in the lounge. Food and drinks were good, as well as the service.

review.title: Loved the place!
review.reviewText: What a beautiful hotel, with a beautiful location. I took a walk along the path by the water. The room was gorgeous--I felt pampered. The only down side--and it's minor--is that there is not a gift/sundries/snack shop.

review.title: NICE,Close to SFO affordable rooms and clean rooms
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean. They welcomed you with warm cookies which were delicious. The price was reasonable and rooms were nice.

review.title: try to rip you off on parking
review.reviewText: They charge $18 for parking per day, which you learn on arrival. Staff then, under questioning, admit that it is only $1/hr if you are just staying one night. But they try to get you to pay the higher rate! Unconscionable!

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, and a bit above average. We enjoyed our stay, and the shuttle service was very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel has an excellent shuttle service.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service was a bit high; we had a thirty-two dollar hamburger.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location.

review.title: Get away trip to SF
review.reviewText: Hotel itself is a little bit old but overall it's clean and well managed.
review.negativeRemarks: noise
review.locationRemarks: few miles away from SFO

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: The only down fall was there was no free breakfast.

review.title: Doble tree - San Francisco
review.reviewText: It had all the ammenities for a comfortable stay except the internet connection in the business center - which was slow and froze too many times.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connectivity

review.title: Great place!
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were clean. We used the hotel shuttle and had no problems -- coming to and from the airport. It came every 15 min as scheduled. Only about a 10 min trip to the airport. Great place to stay close to the airport!

review.title: A Great nights sleep
review.reviewText: One of the best Hotel beds I've ever slept on. Loved the Stay, Park and Fly Package

review.title: Good deal near SFO airport
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very clean and well run. I'd recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: close to airport, clean and quiet
review.locationRemarks: convenient

review.title: Parking Fee!!!
review.reviewText:
They charged extra $18 dollars for parking and $10/day for wifi access!!!
No refrigerator.
Other than that, everything was fine.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was really close to the elevator and parking lot.
review.negativeRemarks: Extra $18 for parking and the room didn't have a refrigerator.

review.title: 5* service 5* reception area 3* room
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival the hotel reception, bar & general surroundings are very classic & traditionally classy ... however, the room, which I paid an upgrade for a larger room was ... standard. The room although fully functioning was in need of some tlc.

Service 110% - brilliant!

Paying $9.95 for 24 hours & $18 per day to park car is just a complete rip in the 21st Century when the base price is considerably higher than say the Red Roof a 100 yards away.

Finally ... I was on the top floor ... 8 ... however, I assume the masts were creaking & groaning constantly in the wind.
review.positiveRemarks: service, free airport shuttle, restaurant food great
review.negativeRemarks: standard size allegedly upgrade room ... room requires tic
review.locationRemarks: 10 mins from SFO

review.title: Back-ache and nickel-and-diming
review.reviewText:
Bed so worn and soft, you roll to the middle. Bad night sleep both nights.

Huge empty parking lot, but, surprise, guests have to pay $16 a night to use it. Shame on you.

Typical small hotel breakfast buffet - $15 per person. That was an expensive bowl of oatmeal.

Wi-Fi in room, but again, only if you pay for it. This is Silicon Valley in 2012?
review.negativeRemarks: petty extra charges make the low room price a lie

review.title: Could have been a great stay
review.reviewText:
In this day and age, there is no excuse for a hotel not to have free internet for it's guest, and no, browsing in the lobby do not count.
Hotel with half the price have free WIFI and what is up with charging me for parking in the hotel i am staying? I paid $20 for a few hours of parking AT the hotel, SERIOUSLY!!!
Will never stay there again.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great view and location. The food was very tasting as well, I would highgly recommend this place.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Right on the water

review.title: Great for pet lovers.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel for pets. Staff was very helpful in giving us a room close to the elevators but far enough away so that it wouldn't be noisy. There's a nice park just to the north of the hotel where you can walk your dogs. The hotel's pet rules are not too restrictive. Everyone was friendly and the room was very clean and nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee of $18 per day
review.locationRemarks: Nice location overlooking the bay

review.title: Great Hotel Great Price
review.reviewText: We spent HOURS look for a very nice, but somewhat cheap for us to stay in, and we're both so very glad we chose the double tree hotel!!! where do i start? hmmm well first off, we got there 2 hours early, and i asked if there was a room available by any chance, and there was, the staff was very kind to us, and the cookies were delicious!!! there wasn't any bad smells or anything, hotel was pretty quiet, and the beds were very comfortable! We loved it!! we got the bay view, which isnt alllll that great, but it was nice seeing the planes land...it was quiet during the night time which was nice, and slept quite well..Lastly, i want to thank the staff so much that they found my phone!!! i mean, they could have easily stolen it too (white iphone!!) it was my fault, i accidentally left it when we checked out, i called them, and within 5 mins they called me back saying they found it in my room, KUDOS FOR BEING HONEST!!....again, this is a great hotel for its price, and i woldnt mind staying in it again!
review.negativeRemarks: the "bay view" but maybe because we got the furthest one
review.locationRemarks: easy to find

review.title: Well designed room, comfortable bed, good shower
review.reviewText: Well designed room, comfortable bed, good shower, attention to details. One of the best hotels I have stayed at in a while.
review.negativeRemarks: You have to tell them that you don't want the newspaper or they automatically charge your for it.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently near the airport, but not too close, so that it is noisy.

review.title: San Francisco stay
review.reviewText: We checked in really late - 1:30 a.m. and they were very accommodating at such an early hour.

review.title: good for family with 3 kids.
review.reviewText: Family with 3 kids, not too much choices around SF really for a reasonable price without having to have 2 rooms, pretty good. Watch for parking fees not being included, no breakfast included... fine as long as you know ahead of time. Not too much comfort, if you are out and about anyway, just fine, we will book it again.
review.positiveRemarks: clean towels and sheets, soaps, cookies at check in
review.negativeRemarks: parking $18 per night, no other option
review.locationRemarks: convenient

review.title: Great accomodations with a minor glitz
review.reviewText: Confusion at check-in....one of the two rooms we were assigned was occupied & the key for the other was ng. Staff made a quick change for us & all was fine.

review.title: Convenient airport location
review.reviewText: This hotel isn't fancy but it is clean and the staff was very nice, friendly, and helpful. The free shuttle to and from the airport was always on time and is a great service.

review.title: Everything was great except the maid cleaning the room for 2 days didn't do a very good job.
review.reviewText: Location was good, food was good and desk clerks were great. The beds were comfy. Maid service was terrible! The second day it didn't even look like they made the bed, just threw the covers back on. pillows on the floor, empty coffee cups sitting around. Second day we had the linens changed, thinking it would be better. The bed looked better but the room itself did not feel clean. I think the fee for daily parking is a bit high, especially since the parking lot was empty. Except for the maid service we enjoyed our stay.

review.title: A nice hotel close to SFO airport
review.reviewText: I needed a comfortable hotel for one-night stay inbetween my flights. Doubletree provided just that: nice clean hotel, quiet and close to SFO airport with a frequent shuttle bus service. I'll definitely stay in here again if I had an early morning flight to catch.

review.title: Great Value Hotel
review.reviewText: If you require your car and know you will be driving all over the peninsula and SF, this is a great little hotel value. Staff runs a great hotel. Close to Burlingame and easy on and off Hwy 101. Quiet, modern, we've now stayed here twice in recent trips to SF.

review.title: I'll Be Back
review.reviewText:
The Doubletree at SFO is a choice hotel for anytime, but particularly if you are flying in late or out early. It was one of the most comfortable hotels I've ever stayed in. It was very clean, quiet, newer, and efficient. I believe the rooms are priced very fairly. The only thing i didn't like was having to pay for parking.
I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Mas o menos (more or less)
review.reviewText:
The hotel was well located and in general ok. They need to give maintenance to the buildinf in general and maybe renovate the furniture and change the elevators.
The bed was very confortable.

review.title: Not happy
review.reviewText: Had to complain to get what I paid for

review.title: Best value for money
review.reviewText: I am extremly satisfied with the hotel stay. The breakfast buffet was awesome. Few of the front desk people are not helpful.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Good cookies.

review.title: Parking is not included and is not listed as a charge on your site
review.reviewText: Hotel in need of repair. Very old and not updated. Parking an addl 18.00 per day.

review.title: One nighter
review.reviewText: Even though we were there for one night, the room was very comfortable, and clean. The front desk clerk was very personable. It was a great start to a wonderful weekend in San Francisco.

review.title: No Frills
review.reviewText: I had thought that Doubletree Hotels were fairly nice but was disappointed to see that the reduction in price showed in its service and room. There doesn't appear to be any bellhops available and we had to lug our own luggage to and from the rooms (an inconvenience when traveling in a group). In addition, the room did not have a working air conditioner or lamp. We needed to open the window and contend with traffic noise.

review.title: very nice and convinient
review.reviewText: very comfortable, great location with access to major freeways. very close to downtown SF. clean rooms, nice staff.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: Hilton owns Doubletree. This was more on the higher end of quality than I'd expected, and I was happy with the place for even my short stay.

review.title: Convenient SFO hotel with free shuttle service
review.reviewText: I booked at the last minute so I had to pay higher rates, but overall I was satisfied with this hotel. Great location, just 10 minutes from SFO by shuttle (which is free). Although I was in a non-smoking room, I had friends who booked a smoking room (by accident) and their room was terrible compared to mine - so beware. The hotel was not able to move them to a non-smoking (or even another smoking room).

review.title: Perfect! Close to airport, good shuttle, free long term parking.
review.reviewText: This was a very pleasant place to stay. The shuttle to the airport took only 10 minutes because this hotel is the last stop before returning to the airport. The service in the hotel was very nice. They gave us very yummy chocolate chip cookies on arrival. We left our car parked in their lot for 8 days. The room together with the parking service cost less than the cost to park our car for that amount of time in an airport parking lot. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: The Best SFO Airport Stay
review.reviewText: Had just returned from 2 weeks in Europe and needed a pit stop in SFO before connecting to a commuter flight home the next day. Totally amazed to discover the Doubletree was way beyond expectations, well appointed, modern, friendly staff, and the warm cookies were a nice touch for the jet lagged!! The cost was actually less than a much lesser spot we stayed on the outbound. This was a place we will return to again...

review.title: doubletree
review.reviewText: very nice hotel

review.title: Can't wait to be back in SFO but not in this Hotel
review.reviewText:
The beds were really small and disapointment was that they charge you 10 USD /day for wi-fi Internet and they also charge 16USD for the Parking.

It is little thing but enough to unlike the hotel stay.

We'll try an other hotel in San francisco because the city is just awesome.

review.title: Not impressed with Doubletree
review.reviewText: I was disappointed that the hotel did NOT inform me of the additional $50.00 charge because I checked in a half hour before the check in time. They just charged my card the next day. Additionally, the air conditioner/heater unit was too loud, there was a light bulb burned out in the floor lamp and the handle repeatedly fell off the faucet. Disappointing for the price.

review.title: Will return.
review.reviewText: With it's close proximity to SFO and Burlingame, shopping and dining was very convenient. The deluxe room was very spacious and comfortable. The only minor inconvenience was the minimal elevators available.

review.title: "as anticipated"
review.reviewText: "we always stay at the doubletree on a park and fly basis prior to our air flights. we know exactly what the conditions of the hotel will be and we are never disappointed..."

review.title: Best place to hop to SFO.
review.reviewText: Modate location from SFO, not too close to be noisey, but close enough to commute in shortest time.

review.title: OK airport hotel
review.reviewText:
Throught the wall heating and air conditioning is very hard to adjust.
Dining room food quality has deteriorated.

review.title: Not bad but doubt I'd stay again
review.reviewText: hotel was beautiful. staff was great. nice place to stay to feel safe & secure. however the people next to us decided to set their alarm at 4am & i called to the front desk & it took them 10 min. to send someone up, then another 5 min. to try to wake the people up by calling them constantly. finally the security guard entered the room & had them shut it off. needless to say, my family of 3 kids, ages 1, 3, & 6 were wide awake, nothing was done to apologize for the inconvenience, except they gave us cookies.

review.title: Doubletree Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is located well just a few steps from the gulf shore. Parking cost us $16 per night. If you choose a hotel from total cost view point, you have to add it on hotel rate.

review.title: Mildew and smoke
review.reviewText: The room smelled like mildew and cigarette smoke (it was a non-smoking room), there were large stains on the rug throughout the entire room, the closest place to buy a bottle of water was the Embassy Suites across the street, and the hotel was very run down. They also do not mention on their web site that their 24 hour shuttle service to/from the airport requires you to call the hotel for pickup after midnight.

review.title: Would like to go back
review.reviewText: Hotel near the SF airport is moset efficient & easy to take public trans to and from the city.

review.title: Bottom line to customer is much higher than the cost of the room.
review.reviewText: You pay too much for what you get.

review.title: A little outdated - other airport hotels are better
review.reviewText: I was disappointed by the Doubletree - the rooms and hallways felt old and outdated, the walls were really thin (could hear everything next door), and there was some loud ventilation equipment running late and night. Decent complimentary toiletries, though. There are much better airport hotels in the area to choose from.

review.title: Double Tree
review.reviewText: The room had a very small window overlooking the bay. Disappointed with that. In less than two weeks, I have come back to the area and I chose Crowne Plaza instead of Double Tree.

review.title: Great airport hotel
review.reviewText: This was one of the better airport hotels I have been in. Most are shabby, run down and taking advantage of the location - noisy, away from amenities and a one night stay. This hotel was much better than that. It was comparable to many good downtown hotels.

review.title: Excellent facility!
review.reviewText: Excellent! Beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I had a couple days of meetings in and arounf San Francisco, and have stayed at a few SFO airport hotels with little satisfaction. But this hotel was well located on the edge of the bay, with great views (sorry I left my camera at home!!), and a convienant walking/running track. I will be using this hotel again!

review.title: Could be better
review.reviewText:
The room was very nice and quiet even though we were near the airport.
Staff was helpful.
Some amenities you receive at less expensive hotels were absent here: No free internet except in the lobby,No free breakfast,No free parking.

review.title: Doubletree Burlingame
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, nice staff, extra parking fees cancelled out good pricing.

review.title: One of my favorite places to stay in the Bay Area
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice, our room was spacious, quiet and clean. However, the toilet was a little too loud when flushed as was the a/c when turned on. Other than that, we were pleased with our room. Plush beds, soft sheets and lots of pillows made for a relaxing and re-energizing sleep or nap. We scored an unbelievable deal from expedia plus free breakfast, so we can't really complain. The service at the restaurant from Lisa during our breakfast meals was quick and efficient, she even calmed down our 3 year old when he was crying. Will stay here again when visiting the bay area...hopefully for the same deal we had this time around hah hah

review.title: Excellent! A first class airport area hotel!
review.reviewText: Would stay there again when having to leave early the next day for a flight. Received a 15% discount coupon upon check-in for the restaurant which was just great with great service and food. Quiet hotel and accurate recommendation from desk staff as to which shuttle to take for on-time check in. Any later would have caused a delay.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText:
the location is good. very close to sfo and san francisco.
and there is shuttle bus to the airport.
but no public transportation. you gotta have a car to go around.
the room is clean and neat.

review.title: Will Never Stay There Again
review.reviewText: The Wireless Internet Didn't Work In The Rooms And The Hotel Just Blew You Off.The Hotel Charges Alot To Park When None Of The Other Hotels Close By Do.The Staff Was Rude And Laughed At Many Of The Coustomer Complaints.

review.title: Great place to stay just outside San Fran
review.reviewText:
The hotel is wonderful! We did have a problem with our key card twice but it was fixed. The bed is extremely comfortable! Would go back anytime!
My only complain is you can not get a smoking room with an ocean view. The room was roomy and the room service was excellent though a little pricey.

I never heard the planes taking off and the hotel is just around 10 miles from San Fran. So much better than paying high on a hotel in the city.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: This Hotel is outdated. Ive stayed at Double trees through out the country and I would say this was by far the worst looking one I've stayed in. Perhaps this was one of the first ones built. It was the first one that I've stayed in that didn't have complimentary wi-fi in the room. You had to go downstairs to the lobby to get free wi-fi or pay some ridiculous fee to use the wired/wi-fi in the room. There were no amenities in the room other than a iron and a hair dryer.

review.title: Like the place
review.reviewText: good place to stay close to airport for relatively cheap price on expedia with cookis thrown in

review.title: The Hotel by the Bay
review.reviewText: This was not my first time at a Doubletree Hotel. I was impressed with the cleanliness and smooth operation a few years ago at the one near Boston, and was delighted to find equally high standards in San Francisco. The rooms are clean, bathrooms spacious, bed comfortable. The rooms have the best blackout shades, so it's really dark when you want to sleep. The hotel is off the beaten track -- there's really nothing near it but other hotels. It's a 20 minute ride into the city, so with a car, no problem. I would not stay there without my own transportation. What else can I say?; Any hotel that provides free, warm, chocolate chip cookies is a good placer to stay.

review.title: Would love to have stayed longer
review.reviewText: My room was wonderful and the staff was very accomodating. I picked this hotel for the shuttle to the airport due to my early flight time. I was able to get a great night sleep and get to the airport in time.

review.title: Convenient airport hotel
review.reviewText: The Doubletree is a good secure place to stay and very convenient for airport departures. Upgraded rooms are comfortable and often provide scenic vistas of San Francisco Bay and the city itself. On a negative note, the Doubletree has eliminated complimentary Internet service in the lobby/restaurant area of the hotel...not good!! I'll search out other alternatives when I return to the San Francisco area.

review.title: Very comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Double Tree always seems to be clean, quiet and comfortable. Will choose it again in the future.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was friendly but not very helpful. The bed was terribly lumpy and uncomfortable . When I brought this to the attention of the front desk they didn't offer a different room or any attempt of solving the issue. This is a Doubletree property and I would expect much more from them having stayed in their properties across the country. I forgot my toothbrush as this was a last minute trip. The front desk idiots couldn't even find a guest toothbrush nor could they direct me to someplace where I could purchase one!!

review.title: Very nice hotel, not 'secure' parking
review.reviewText: Very nice, well kept hotel. Rooms were good sizes. Although the parking was 'gated' and there was a security shack, we did not see security during our stay and easily entered/exited the parking area without question - leaving 'secure' vehicles at risk. The complimentary shuttle to the airport was very prompt and pleasant. Would stay again.

review.title: It was really good deal!
review.reviewText: We went 10days vacation. We got the park and fly deal. This deal was really good. It was cheaper than just park the carat air port or some parking place.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful. I would like to not be charged for a rollaway bed, though.

review.title: staff was the best!
review.reviewText: Wow. They greeted me with a warm cookie. All the staff were warm and friendly. They took very good care of me. Very attentive to my questions and needs. I would go there again for my meetings.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very convenient to the airport and BART. Only troulbe was getting from the Caltrain station back to the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel near airport
review.reviewText: This hotel is very nice to stay in and the beds are very comfortable, plus it is close to the airport. Staff was nice and the warm cookies at check in a plus. The only downside is the parking fee which I feel should be lowered or free, considering you are away from downtown San Francisco. Would consider staying again in the future.

review.title: Pay for parking
review.reviewText: I will not stay in this hotel again because of having to pay for parking. I understand having to pay for parking in a downtown parking garage but this hotel is located with plenty of room and all outdoor parking lot. The parking lot is outside, exposed to the elements, self parking and you still had to pay $16.00 a day.

review.title: Good Service, bad location, needs remodeling
review.reviewText: Very nice people, the location was not very good. Had to take BART everywhere, got expensiveand took a long time. You have to pay for parking, which is really stupid. $15.00 a day.

review.title: Hotel Staff Rude
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is great it was actually our second time staying here. Once back in May 2009 it was fabulous and so we decided "If it's not broke why fix it" unfortunately this time around the staf at check in was quite rude, they were not helpful and they do not have a pool and they have upped their charge for parking and it's ridiculous because parking is horrible.

review.title: Parking was too expensive. Besides that everything else was wonderful. Loved the warm cookies.
review.reviewText: The stay was wonderful the only thing that got me was the parking. one day of parking cost me $16.00. In my opinion that's a little high of a price for one days parking in a down economy.

review.title: Bedding Was Very Luxurious!
review.reviewText: Room was comfortable and appeared clean. The handle on the faucet fell off, and someone was there immediately to reattach it. The beds were extremely comfortable; the bedding very luxurious. If you're there mainly to sleep, this is a great place! Comlimentary shuttle service to the airport is provided every few minutes in the early morning, and then at frequent intervals throughout the day; if you're driving to the airport it's quick and simple to get there. There's a restaurant onsite, although we didn't eat there. Complimentary coffee in the rooms, and warm chocolate chip cookies at the front desk.

review.title: Good hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: We just needed a place near the airport since we were flying out the next day. The rates were very reasonable, but you get what you pay for. I would say that the breakfast was very good.

review.title: View
review.reviewText: Loved the bay view, watching the planes right over the water and downtown Oakland in the distance. Shuttle to the Bart was easy. Very glad we stayed there.

review.title: Great airport hotel
review.reviewText: Very happy with this choice of hotel near sfo and for area sightseeing

review.title: Great weekend!
review.reviewText: We were greeted with smiles and warm cookies. The front desk staff was pleasant and helpful in recommending nearby "hot spots" and entertainment activities. The only bummer was the additional parking fee we did not expect.

review.title: nice stay
review.reviewText: We steid in a hotel only 1 night before our flight back. It was very nice. Check-in was quick and the man in the reception was extra nice. Warm cookis was pleasent surprise. Room was clean and comfy. Nice stay, I'll be back!

review.title: Shuttle service left a lot to be desired.
review.reviewText: Shuttle service left a lot to be desired... Staff was very kind and friendly and the cookies were awesome!

review.title: never go back
review.reviewText: We drove to the hotel and parked the car at the hotel parking lot. I thought it was free parking but they charged the parking fee even I was a hotel guest. I was not very happy about that.

review.title: Fine hotel to stay at...
review.reviewText: This is our third stay at the Airport Doubletree during the 2009 summer months. Access to our varied destinations via Hwy 101 is excellent. Parking rates seem normal for the area; however, if you upgrade your room as we have done, the parking rate is decreased. Room comfort, while neither opulent nor spacious, serves our two-person needs, and the hotel cleaning staff does an excellent and thorough job of keeping the room clean and orderly. Room rates are reasonable as well.

review.title: Convenient and lovely airport hotel option
review.reviewText: I have stayed in the DoubleTree at SFO several times, mostly about ten years ago when I was in San Francisco on business and have always loved its location on the Bay with the park and bayside walk adjacent. It's really a nice hotel at a reasonable price and so easy to deal with from and to the airport. It has actually gotten better (and bigger!) since my earlier stays a decade ago--the rooms, for instance, are much nicer, the bedding far more upscale. And I love the views of the Bay and north towards the airport and the city! It's much quieter than being closer to SFO and yet it's only 3 quick miles away. I definitely recommend it and would stay there again if I return to San Francisco on my way thru to somewhere else, as was the case on this last visit in late June 2009.

review.title: Great park and fly hotel ... would do it again.
review.reviewText: My husband and I had a flight out of SFO so we decided to use the park and fly option at the SFO Doubletree. The hotel was very comfortable and we really appreciated the ability to leave our car there for a week with shuttle service to and from the airport. We'll definitely stay there again when we fly out of SFO.

review.title: overnight
review.reviewText: Overnight stay prior to leaving area. All personnel were very friendly and helpfull. Transfers to airport was efficient.

review.title: nice setting
review.reviewText: i enjoyed every aspect this hotel had to offer.i loved the view of the bay,and made me very relaxed and comfortable.

review.title: Excellent business value
review.reviewText: Hotel was attractiven comfortable, and quiet

review.title: expensive parking
review.reviewText: I was disappointed at this hotel. This hotel's parking fee is $16/night. Here is not downtown area. It's too expensive.

review.title: Relaxing, but lacks amenities.
review.reviewText: Relaxing atmosphere. Great and comfortable bed. Courteous staff. Lacks amenities such as an in room safe, refrigerator, and microwave.

review.title: Extremely Satisfied
review.reviewText: I was only there for one (short) night, but the front desk staff had me checked in in a flash, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. When I needed more coffee and creamer in the morning someone was up with it right away.

review.title: decent hotel
review.reviewText: I would go back to this hotel.

review.title: enjoyed the stay with my girlfriend
review.reviewText: convenient location to 49ers game at candlestick

review.title: Love the cookies!
review.reviewText: Good location close to the airpot.

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: The staff was super friendly, the room and bed was very comfortable. The only cons were that there was a strange odor the first couple nights (which we believe was the breeze off the bay) and that the Coke machine was always empty! Good workout facility and nice walking path around the bay. Don't appreciate paying for parking but as I was at the hotel for a business meeting, they reduced it down and I was happy with that.

review.title: Doubletree Burlingame
review.reviewText: We stayed Halloween night - the hotel was decorated appropriately. Check-in was very efficient, staff was cordial, and the traditional cookies were great. Very comfortable clean room, and reasonably priced. The hotel made a good base of operations for our our one-day tour of San Francisco, then flying out next evening.

review.title: Perfect for an overnight to the airport
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable rooms...convenient airport shuttle...well priced breakfast downstairs...and don't forget the excellent cookies!

review.title: Hotel was nice
review.reviewText: Room were clean. Staff was nice. It ws a little hard to find

review.title: Comfortable and Convenient
review.reviewText: This hotel is our choice when we have a morning flight out of SFO and need to stay close to the airport to get out early.

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel at a great price for the area. Pleasent staff. Clean room. Clean lobby. Helpful, courteous personel.

review.title: I recommend
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Easy to find. Very clean. Friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: closed to SFO
review.reviewText: Arriving with a rental car and flying from SFO three days later, it was a good option. A very convenient free shuttle can take you from the hotel to the airport and the Bart Station. Very good choice of hotel if you have a plane to take but a little bit too far from San Francisco if you plan to visit the city for a few days.

review.title: Excellent value off the usual path
review.reviewText: This friendly hotel, across the street from San Francisco Bay and the nature park, was an excellent value. The room was clean, quiet, and comfortable, the staff accommodating and the food good. Since the Doubletree is not a waterfront property, the prices reflect the savings. I especially liked the fresh hot cookies and the relaxing public areas with bookshelves, traditional decor, and a fireplace.

review.title: Exceeded Expectations
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean. The rooms were warm and comfortable. Everything was great and worth the price. There is only one low point, there are no vents in the bathrooms. Overall a great experience.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Free Shuttle was great!

review.title: nice before going on trip
review.reviewText: Nice and quiet. Good start to a vacation. Needs more food choices during the day besides room service

review.title: perfect for an overnight stay between flights
review.reviewText: Clean,well maintained hotel,very close to airport.Added bonus is the free shuttle to and from the airport.Very comfy bed and the price is right if you get the special 'no cancellation rate".

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable bed and room size ample

review.title: Will visit again
review.reviewText: Only thing I did not like was having to pay $50 for parking. So please know ahead of time you will be charged if you have to park your car. Other than that trip was great. If you stay there make sure to get directions to "STACKS". Best (and affordable) breakfast in the world.

review.title: Hit and Miss
review.reviewText: The hospitality staff at the front desk was initially unwilling to help me with a glitch in my registration, but did eventually come through. Light bulbs in the guest room were burned out! Otherwise the room was clean, and the buffet lunch at my continuing education program was excellent.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: Overall is really good but the internet and mini frige should be included.

review.title: Excellent choice for near SF airport
review.reviewText: The hotel lives up to the quality expected in a Doubletree. Lovely, warm atmosphere restaurant with efficient staff and good food. I have stayed there many times and have always been pleased with the facility and service. CHeck-in is smoothe and of course the warm chocolate cookies are wonderful :)

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The room was very clean. The staff was very courteous. THe hotel has wonderful cookies nightly. Dont miss the free trolley that goes into Burlingame for night time. The hotel doesnt have much by way of services around it s be prepared to eat away from the hotel. Given taht you have to go somewhere to do anything, the staff could have been more helpful regarding options getting around.

review.title: Happy Customer
review.reviewText: I am very satisfied with the hotel. Although my stay was only 2 nights, I will definitely choose the place next time I travel. I love the cookies too.

review.title: Luxury & Excellence
review.reviewText: The beds were fabulous, soft & luxurious. The soap products were by nutrogena & not some cheap brand. The staff was very helpful & courteous.

review.title: Neat and close to the airport
review.reviewText: We had just arrived from a long trip to China and needed a haven for 12 hours. The hotel staff was helpful and the beds were amazing. Definitely recommend it for travelers.

review.title: Good place to kick back
review.reviewText: Great location, hotel not the most modern but friendly
